timeline.bodyText: There will be some checkstyle failures such as missing MIT header. And adding documentation to public methods/classes.
timeline.author: conniey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,139 @@
+package com.azure.data.tables;

timeline.bodyText: Undo space.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: REmove file if it is commented out.
timeline.author: conniey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,134 @@
+//package com.azure.data.tables;

timeline.bodyText: Names of test files should match class it is testing. autorestTest should be AzureTableImplTest
timeline.author: conniey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,364 @@
+package com.azure.data.tables;

timeline.bodyText:
Sort methods by visibility and keep like methods together. For example, all tests should be together @Test. If it is a @BeforeEach or @AfterEach, put them at the top.
Helper methods like auth() should be made private and at the bottom.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText:
This test should inherit from TestBase.
If this test is run on the same resource twice, it will fail. If you look at the AppConfiguration tests, they use testResourceNamer. https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/appconfiguration/azure-data-appconfiguration/src/test/java/com/azure/data/appconfiguration/ConfigurationClientTestBase.java#L56
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Please clean up unnecessary empty lines.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: You can call the method deleteTable(...). Helper isn't necessary. DeleteTable is enough to describe the functionality of the method.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: There's no need to sleep. The .block() call only moves to the next line when it is complete.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: helper is unnecessary.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText:
These tests should follow arrange, act, and assert. All declarations should be done before your Act & Assert steps.
https://docs.telerik.com/devtools/justmock/basic-usage/arrange-act-assert#verify-interaction
An example:
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/servicebus/azure-messaging-servicebus/src/test/java/com/azure/messaging/servicebus/ServiceBusSenderClientTest.java#L165
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText:
This can be simplified to. Same with the line below.
this.accountName = Objects.requireNonNull(accountName, "'accountName' cannot be null.");
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: requestURL should be requestUrl as-per our naming guidelines.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: It is not necessary to qualify this with this., there are no naming conflicts within this method. Same with the other usages.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Remove this.. Same with the instance above.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText:
The ternary operator is easier to read when it is split like this:
String dateHeader = headers.containsKey("x-ms-date") 
    ? "" 
    : this.getStandardHeaderValue(headers, "Date");
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Does the case matter? If it does not, is equalsIgnoreCase() better to use than equals()?
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: null.? In correct replacement?
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: super.beforeTest() is an empty method, you can remove this.

timeline.bodyText: I'd be consistent about using final. If you use final here. I'd expect you to use it in all other cases in your code where you don't expect variables to be reassigned.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: nit: trailing new lines
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: If you import this, it won't need to be fully qualified.

conniey

replies.bodyText: Same with any other instances where you do this .getValue().getValue().
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText:
I'd add an assertion here so we don't continue the test if the set-up was incorrect.
Assertions.notNull(connectionString, "Cannot continue test if connectionString is not set.");
timeline.author: conniey
